lines.text: [Matt and Spence are helping Rain]
When I get outta here... think I'm gonna get laid.
Yeah, you might want to clean up a little bit first.
You're all going to die down here.
[Alice points her gun at Rain]
I'm not dead yet.
[Rain takes the gun from Alice]
I think I'll take this back.
I could kiss you, you bitch!
[Rain and J.D. have just fought off a zombie]
I shot her five times. How was she still standing?
Bitch isn't standing now.
Your boyfriend's a real asshole.
There's a cure!
[to Rain]
You're gonna be alright!
I was beginning to worry.
I don't want to be one of those things. Walking around without a soul.
That homicidal bitch killed my team.
That homicidal bitch may be our only way out of here.
All the people that were working here are dead.
Well, that isn't stopping them from walking around.
Bitch wouldn't open the door, so I had to fry her.
[first lines]

At the beginning of the 21st century, the Umbrella Corporation had become the largest commercial entity in the United States. Nine out of every ten homes contain its products. Its political and financial influence is felt everywhere. In public, it is the world's leading supplier of computer technology, medical products, and healthcare. Unknown, even to its own employees, its massive profits are generated by military technology, genetic experimentation, and viral weaponry.
She bit me, man. She took a chunk clean outta me.
No pressure, guys.

[held down]
You can't do this!

[removing gas mask]
Blow me.

Even in death the human body still is active. Hair and finger nails continue to grow, new cells are produced, and the brain itself holds a small electrical charge that takes months to dissipate. The T-virus provides a massive jolt, both to cellular growth, and to those trace electrical impulses. Put quite simply, it reanimates the body.
It brings the dead back to life?
Not fully. The subjects have the simplest of motor functions. Perhaps a little memory, but virtually no intelligence. They're driven by the basest of impulses, the most basic needs.
Which is?
The need to feed.
I've been a bad, bad girl.
What happened here?
[Alice and Matt both look towards "One" rather anxiously for an answer as well]
Five hours ago Red Queen went homicidal, sealed the Hive and killed everyone down here.
Jesus!
When we realized what was happening, my team was dispatched to shut her down.
Why did she do it?
That we don't know, but outside interference is a possibility.
I can give you the code, but first you must do something for me.
What?
One of your group has been infected. I require her life for the code.
What are they? It's pretty goddamn obvious what they are. Lab coats, badges, THOSE PEOPLE USED TO WORK HERE!
You're going to have to work for your meal.
I'm missing you already.
In or out? In... or out?
I don't know what we had, but it's over.

[a female scientist zombie bites Spence]
OH, GOD!

[Spence shoots the scientist; Matt fights Spence for the gun]
Back... the FUCK off!

[to Alice]
I'm missing you already.
[Locks Alice, Rain, and Matt inside the flooded research lab]
[the lethal laser bar approaching One becomes an unavoidable lattice]
Shit!

[surrounded by zombies, Kaplan contemplates suicide and finds one bullet left in his gun]
That's lucky.

[the team runs towards Rain after hearing gunshots]
What was all the shooting?
We found a survivor.
And you shot him?
She was crazed. She bit me.
[last lines]

I want her quarantined - close observation and a full series of blood tests. Let's see if she's infected. Take her to Raccoon City facility. Then assemble the team. We're reopening the hive. We want to know what went on down there. Just do it.
I implore you.
Implore away!

[J.D. enters a code to open a secured door]
You got it?
See how easy that was?

[the door opens only to find a room extremely full of the undead flesh-eating zombies]
Shit!

[yells]
J.D., no! Grab my hand and hold it real tight!
Don't let me go!

[the zombies pulls J.D. back; Rain lets him go]
RAIN! FUCK! NO!
[zombies chomping and devouring; J.D. screaming]

[points the gun at Matt]
Please, I wouldn't wanna shoot you. I might need the bullets. Back off!
Why didn't you tell us about the antivirus?
This long after infection, there was no guarantee it would work.
But there's a chance... right?
I don't deal in chance.
Just one bite, one scratch from these creatures is sufficient. And then, you become one of them.
Nothing - ever - changes.
What the fuck was that?
I'm not sure I want to remember what went on down here.
I don't blame you.

[being pushed]
Thank you!
Some people.
Yeah.
The T-virus is protean, changing from liquid to airborne to blood transmission, depending on its environment. It is almost impossible to kill.
She was right. We are gonna die down here.

[they see the holographic representation of the Red Queen]
It's a Holographic representation of the Red Queen, modeled after the head programmer's daughter. Don't listen to anything she says. She's only trying to deceive us... confuse us... she'll say anything to stop us shutting her down.
[letting blood from her wounded hand drip down onto the zombies below them]
Yeah, you like how I taste, don't you?

[One is holding one of his dying soldiers]
Stay conscious. You're going into shock.

[the soldier closes his eyes]
Stay awake!
Watch the tank! The tank!
